ygData.subject: RE: Leatherfoot raider cap quest spoiler request
ygData.msgSnippet: My info may be wrong it came from AllaKhazam s website...these errors have been known to happen. I hope I am wrong...sorry to alarm you! - Faras
ygData.messageBody:
My info may be wrong it came from AllaKhazam's website...these errors have
been known to happen.

I hope I am wrong...sorry to alarm you!

- Faras

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:Dean_Kimes@...]
> Sent: Friday, September 17, 1999 2:47 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Leatherfoot raider cap quest spoiler request
>
>
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Gah! Only if it happened since last nite as I died and was
> able to put mine
> back on. If this trend continues there will be no items in
> the game that
> bards can use. Right now all the cool items I have come from
> quests from
> other races/classes that I can do because of carillion, except for
> Crookstinger of course! When I saw the new armor from the
> ogre head quest I
> was devastated. That armor clad me well when I was lower
> level and I could
> not have gotten it without the generosity of those fine
> dwarves. Apparently
> rather than take the needed step of making items break Verant
> has decided to
> merely make everything limited to classes or races. So much
> for variation
> and so much for meaningful quests. Bards already have next
> to zero quests
> worth doing, I got a wonderful Chant of Battle scroll from
> the Broken Lute
> quest, yet the Qeynos Cleric/Paladin Cure quest nets you a
> wonderful magic
> weapon. If Verant continues to make quests totally specific
> to the various
> classes in their rewards and applications then I will be
> truly thru with
> this game. Quests are the one thing that keeps me playing, I
> love doing
> them and getting the reward is a nice second benefit. I do a
> lot of quests
> for items I can't use already, but if all the quests were
> like that... I
> would imagine their next step would be to make all quest
> rewards no drop.
> That would really be the last straw as far as I'm concerned.
> Can anyone say
> NeverWinter Nights...
>
> Kitasi the perturbed and concerned
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Roach [mailto:mroach@...]
> Sent: Friday, September 17, 1999 1:31 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Leatherfoot raider cap quest spoiler request
>
>
> From: Mike Roach <mroach@...>
>
> Careful with this quest Galtin, much like the new bloodforge
> armor that has
> replaced the blackened as a reward for the ogre heads quest
> in BB/Kaladim, I
> hear that the raider cap is now Halfling only.
>
> - Faras
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4
> [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> > Sent: Friday, September 17, 1999 2:37 PM
> > To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> > Subject: [eqbards] Leatherfoot raider cap quest spoiler request
> >
> >
> > From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
> >
> > Since this item is nice for a bard to have (+10 CHR), I
> > would like to get
> > some help with it from this list.
> >
> >
> > Spoiler space:
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Marshall Anrey in Rivervale gives you this quest. It
> > requires you to give
> > him a dragoon dirk. In return, he will give you the
> > leatherfoot raider cap.
> > According to some spoiler sites, you have to give him a polar
> > bear skin/hide
> > (can't remember which) first before you can do the
> > leatherfoot raider cap
> > quest. I thought I had read a long time ago on this list
> > that you could
> > bypass the first quest and just give him the dirk from the
> > outset. I tried
> > that last night and ended up losing my dragoon dirk without
> > getting the cap.
> > Can someone who has completed the leatherfoot raider cap
> > quest tell me how
> > they did it? Also, the Marshall conned amiably to me and I
> > was singing the
> > carillion when I gave him the dirk. That didn't make a
> difference.
> >
> > Thanks
> >
> > Galtin of E'ci
> >
